snippet: Western officials say they are worried that the civil war in Syria could create a cohort of radicalized young people, experienced with warfare, who hold European or American passports.
abstract: Western officials and intelligence officials react with alarm to what they say are rising number of young people leaving Europe and United States to wage jihad against Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad, say they are worried that the civil war in Syria could create a cohort of radicalized young people, experienced with warfare, who hold European or American passports.

byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger and Alan Cowell contributed reporting from London, and Alissa J. Rubin from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Western officials say they are worried that the civil war in Syria could create a cohort of radicalized young people, experienced with warfare, who hold European or American passports.

headline.main: Flow of Westerners to Syria Prompts Security Concerns
headline.print_headline: Flow of Westerners to Syria Prompts Security Concerns
